Summary: apparent satellite does 360 turn fades, relights, fades
divs: sighting detailsat about 5 am this morning in the sky north and just to the east of the big dipper from my view (downtown chandler) i saw a very smooth, perhaps 1\3 second, meteor fall at an angle toward the earth of about 30degrees from ne to sw. as bright as venus, but with no flames or tail. a treat and a cause to engage in skywatching for another cup of coffee. about 15 minutes later i spotted what looked like a satellite, faint but definite starlike light constant and smooth in motion directly to the east of the bigdipper's handle "middle". sorry for lack of knowledge of stars - there are two or three stars to the big dippers "handel" east, almost due north of me and at about 70degrees above horizon which this 'satellite' was passing between. it was traveling from n\nw to s\se, when it smoothly and abruptly did a sharp turn to the east and then a smooth arc of about 180degrees and headed almost due north. it went ouot, and immediately "lit-up" again, went out, lit-up still traveling and then went out entirely. it didn't appear to "fade" but as tho light turned off. it did not have any flashing lights, or colored lights. it was of the brightness of those stars i mention above to the the east of the bdipper. i am somewhat (as interested observer with second story window) familiar with the pattern of local municipal airports and small craft, the metropolis jet flight paths, as well as interstate traffic at high altitude, and military jets. i have not witnessed this before. i have seen a half dozen or so times differnt satellites and also the iss, none of those made such an odd and seemingly unpredictable turn. i went in and got my camera, but it did not appear again.
trends: There have been 52 other sightings in Chandler
There were no other sightings in Chandler on or around March 2nd 2011
